author: Staff Reporter
text:
Disappointed over non-filing of counter affidavits by government officials on a public interest litigation petition seeking to mandatorily provide ramp facility at multi-storied hospitals facilitating easy evacuation of patients during an emergency, the Madras High Court on Tuesday imposed costs on three government agencies and ordered personal appearance of three senior officials on March 7.

The First Bench of Chief Justice S.K. Kaul and Justice Pushpa Sathyanarayana directed the appearance of the Principal Secretary, Department of Health and Family Welfare, Member Secretary of Chennai Metropolitan Development Authority and the Secretary, Medical Council of India.

The Bench also imposed a cost of Rs. 10,000 each on the three agencies and directed the officials concerned to file the affidavits within three weeks.
title: HC imposes costs on 3 govt. agencies, summons officials
